dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooden bleachers line the surrounding walls of the Olympi sized pool. The room is empty. MOONLIGHT shines through t skylights, reflecting off the water. Nikes, Jay-Z T-shirt and an iTouch are piled at the pool's edge. CAMERA CRANES INSIDE the water. AT THE POOL'S BOTTOM, we find... PERCY JACKSON, age 17, sitting with his legs crossed, dre in cargo shorts. His eyes are closed. His long, dirty blonde hair floats around him. His expression is peaceful

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ever since I was a kid, I liked being in the water. It's where I do my best thinking. Sometimes, when I concentrate, I hear this distant voice... like somebody trying to guide me, give me direction... Weird, huh? Percy opens his eyes, shoots to the surface, fills his lu with air.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Probably just water on the brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large campus in upstate New York. Old, brick buildings scattered across several well-manicured acres. Percy walk alone across campus, dressed like a Venice Beach surf rat listening to an iPod. His attitude is tough, hard, cool.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My name is Percy Jackson. Until a few months ago, I was a student here at Yancy Academy. The kind of place where parents send their "troubled" kids when no one else will take them. A fight breaks out between a group of students. Teachers to break it up. Percy keeps on walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 52 year old, grey haired, bearded teacher in a wheelcha MR. BRUNNER, lectures to a group of kids who would rather elsewhere. Percy stares at his textbook.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My so-called troubles, had impressive- sounding names-- Percy squints at the text. The words MORPH into odd shape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --like "dyslexia" and "attention deficit disorder." But I had a better name for them: boredom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy's roommate is asleep, SNORING. A pair of rusted, metallic FOREARM CRUTCHES lean against his roommate's bed Percy lies awake, the walls around him covered with poste of SURFERS riding EXTREME WAVES. Tacked to the wall is a photograph: Percy and his mom, in happier times.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was also supposed to have some displaced rage because my father abandoned my mom before I was born. But quite honestly, none of that really mattered... Distant THUNDER roars. Percy gets up, looks out his windo STORM CLOUDS form in the sky, obscure the moon.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-because my real troubles were just beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky above Manhattan is heavy with dark, ominous cloud A "YANCY ACADEMY" BUS is parked in front of the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spacious, glass-domed room filled with ancient GREEK ARTIFACTS, rusted WEAPONS, and ARTWORK. In the center of room, are imposing SCULPTURES of the TWELVE OLYMPIAN GODS MR. BRUNNER lectures from his wheelchair

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: There are twelve Olympian Gods. The major three were brothers, who went on to rule the world. Zeus became the King of the gods and ruled the sky. His brother, Poseidon ruled the sea. And their other brother, Hades, ruled the underworld. A group of fairly disinterested high school SENIORS stand around Mr. Brunner. Percy stands off to the side, sweatsh pulled up to hide his ipod headphones. GROVER, Percy's roommate, stands beside him. Grover is overweight, with curly brown hair, glasses, a wispy goatee and a perpetual expression of lust and mischief. Using his cell phone, Grover snaps a photo of the Aphrodite statue's breasts. Brunner notices. Frowns. Not amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grover. Please. Grover looks up. Guilty. Brunner extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: A little more respect for the Gods. Grover sighs, hands over the cell phone. Brunner looks at the photos, holds up the camera for the class to see. The kids chuckle at the image of Aphrodite's breasts.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: What does this tell us about Grover?

dialogues.speaker: CUTE GIRL
dialogues.text: He's a sex addict.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Possibly. Grover may be a tad more, hormonally challenged than most teenagers. But he still shares a similar weakness with all of us. Lust.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: (leans to cute girl) I knew we had something in common.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: It's something the Greek Gods also shared with us. There were several occasions, when the Gods would come down to earth and... how shall I put this?...

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Hook up.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: They would hook up with mortals. Several kids snicker.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: The children of these unions were half- God and half-human. Can anyone tell me what they were called? Mr. Brunner scans to DREW BOBOFIT, a tough, angry, mean spirited bully with a buzzcut and tattoos.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Mr. Bobofit?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Bastards? Mongrels? Mutts?  4. Drew's two friends, two hoodlums named TONY and VINCE, la Brunner scowls, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Anyone else? Percy? But Percy doesn't hear, lost in his music. Grover uses on of his crutches to yank the headset out of Percy's ear.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Huh? What?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: What is the proper name for the offspring of a human and a God? Percy narrows his eyes, thinks, finally... it comes to hi

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Demigods.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Very good, Mr. Jackson. (to Drew Bobofit) Mr. Bobofit, you and the rest of the class obviously need a bit more incentive to learn this material. Perhaps a quiz will help. Tomorrow. Chapters 7 and 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy and Grover enter. Grover, using his crutches, walks with a pronounced limp.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I can't get above a D in most classes. But somehow, without even studying... I get this stuff...

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: (ironic smile) Maybe it's in your blood. The bathroom door FLIES OPEN. Drew and his friends enter, shove past Grover, nearly knocking him down.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Out of the way, Crip.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth, Drew. Drew turns, walks back to Percy, getting in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who should keep your mouth shut, Jackson. If you weren't so busy kissing Brunner's ass, we wouldn't be having a quiz tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Big deal. You have to study. Grow up.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Not all of us can get a fancy tutor by pretending we have dyslexia.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I'm not pretending. I mix things up. Like right now, I could swear your dick is where your head is supposed to be. Furious, Drew and his gang DRAG Percy him into a STALL. D tries to SHOVE Percy's head into the toilet bowl. Percy STRUGGLES to break free. Grover BANGS on the stall door.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Percy!? As Percy's face gets closer to the toilet water, the wate begins to CHURN and BUBBLE, growing in POWER.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Stop! Drew keeps PUSHING. The water CHURNS violently.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I... said... STOP! Suddenly, a BLAST OF WATER EXPLODES out of the toilet bow The water moves with EXTREME FORCE and a definite PURPOSE It SHOOTS past Percy, STRIKES Drew and the boys with the power of a FIREHOUSE, blows them out of the stall and... ..-ACROSS the bathroom floor, right past Grover. They lan UNDER the urinals. Grover SEES Percy step out of the stal Percy is SHAKEN, CONFUSED. UNSURE what just happened.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Percy... Let's go... Drew and the boys get back on their feet, SOAKED. They BL Percy and Grover's exit. A CREAKING SOUND fills the room. Followed by a low, GROAN NOISE and the sound of pipes RATTLING.  6. Then -- CRACK! CRACK! -- several HAIRLINE FRACTURES form the walls and on the floor, spreading out like spiderwebs Urinals and sinks EXPLODE, firing like missiles across th bathroom. Water RUSHES in through the holes in the wall, forming into the shape of several snake-like TENTACLES. The water-tentacles WHIP through the room, like living creatures. They ATTACK Drew and his friends. Grover watches in AMAZEMENT. Percy is BAFFLED, standing i the center of the maelstrom. The floor beneath Drew's feet CRACKS OPEN. A GEYSER of wa shoots upward. The Powerful water LIFTS Drew into the air The bathroom door FLIES OPEN. MR. BRUNNER rolls in. STUNN by what he sees. The Geyser quickly DISSOLVES. Drew FALLS to the floor, ri on top of his soggy, freaked-out friends. The other water STOPS FLOWING, retreating back into the pipes, leaving PO OF WATER everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: What's going on?!?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Jackson. He blew up the bathroom. Mr. Brunner looks very CONCERNED. Percy's expression is equal parts amazement, confusion, and fear.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I didn't... I don't... it just-- Mr. Brunner nods, speaks softly, almost knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: --happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry, Percy is sitting across from Mr. Brunner's desk. Grover stands in the background.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Detention!? But it wasn't my fault... I don't even know how it happened...

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: I believe you, Percy. But Dean Campbell wants to suspend you. I argued for a compromise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One month detention is a compromise?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: For you? Yes. You've been to six different schools in eight years. You've got a D-minus average. You're on very thin ice.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Perfect. I like cold water.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: You really want to be expelled from another school?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Do I really give a damn?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Maybe you don't. But your Mother does. (soft, solemn) Don't let her down again. The words sting. Percy looks out the window. Troubled, upset. Mr. Brunner feels Percy's torment. Mr. Brunner tak a THICK BOOK off his shelf.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: I want you to read this.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: You know that I can't--

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Try. Mr. Brunner places the book in front of Percy. The writin on the cover is in GREEK. Percy refuses to look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, THUNDER rumbles. We are inside a dark, ancient library with high vaulted ceilings and lead glass windows Rows and rows of towering bookshelves stand along the wal each with its own ladder-on-wheels. Percy sits at a long wooden table, in the middle of the r He is alone, save for the LIBRARIAN, a small elderly woma Percy is trying to read Mr. Brunner's book, staring at th GREEK LETTERS on the cover. He squints. The Greek letters MORPH INTO ENGLISH LETTERS. They read: GUIDE TO GREEK MYTHS AND LEGENDS." Percy is surprised, pu the book close and reads to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Father of the Olympians was Kronos. He was the King of the Titans-" (pauses, a small smile) I can... read?... There is a LOUD CRASH. The sound of BREAKING GLASS. Percy LOOKS UP and sees... A CREATURE, hidden in the SHADOWS, LEAPS through the wind The creature LANDS on the floor and slowly RISES UP. It's over TWELVE FEET TALL. The librarian SCREAMS. The creature PULLS BACK its arm, SWIPES at the librarian with tremendous force. The librarian is KNOCKED OFF her feet, FLIES through the and SLAMS into the wall. OUT COLD. Percy STANDS. TERRIFIED. He starts to BACK AWAY. The creature TURNS, faces Percy and STEPS FORWARD. INTO t light. It is the MINOTAUR. HALF MAN. HALF BULL. MUSCULAR, with a long snout, cruel yellow eyes, and battered razor-sharp horns. Seeing Percy the Minotaur ROARS, then SPEAKS in an inhuman VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: MINOTAUR
dialogues.text: Where is it?! Percy turns and SPRINTS toward the door. The Minotaur RACES after him. Faster than Percy, the Minotaur is UPON HIM in seconds. The Minotaur GRABS Percy, LIFTS him into the air and HURL him at a bookshelf. Percy SLAMS into the shelves, FALLS t the floor, buried under a PILE OF BOOKS. Percy is STUNNED. The wind knocked out of him. The Minota RUNS FORWARD, lifts its arm, about to PUMMEL Percy... Percy ROLLS OUT of the way. The Minotaur's arm JUST MISSE Percy and SMASHES a hole in the library floor. Percy gets to his feet, DASHES around the corner. The Minotaur FOLLOWS. Percy KICKS one of the wooden ladders i the path of the creature. The Minotaur SLAMS through the ladder as if it were balsa wood. Percy heads for the LIBRARY DOORS.  9. The Minotaur RUNS up, SWINGS its razor sharp claw across Percy's back. The claws RIP through his jacket. Percy CRI OUT in pain, falls to his knees. The Minotaur MOVES IN FO THE KILL. The library doors BURST OPEN. The Minotaur STOPS, TURNS t the sound.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Percy! Mr. Brunner races into the room on his wheelchair, holdin simple BALL POINT PEN.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Use this. Mr. Brunner THROWS the pen to Percy. Confused, Percy CATC the pen. Brunner SHOUTS.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Click it!

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Click it! The pen is mightier than the sword. Percy CLICKS the pen. IT TRANSFORMS INTO A LARGE, SHARP M SWORD! Percy stares at the blade in DISBELIEF. The Minotaur TURNS BACK to Percy, who is on his feet, wielding the heavy sword. Percy LUNGES FORWARD and SWINGS. The tip of the sword SLI DEEP ACROSS the creature's arm. The Minotaur CRIES OUT. BLOOD seeps from its wound. This only makes the creature ANGRIER. The Minotaur CHARGES Per Percy SWINGS again, this time SLICING DEEP into the Minotaur's TORSO. The Minotaur HOWLS in pain, holding his bleeding CHEST WO With a final GROWL, the Minotaur TURNS and LEAPS OUT of t library window. Percy looks around the room, a gigantic mess of DESTROYED books, furniture and bookcases. Percy glances to the swor It CHANGES BACK into a common everyday ballpoint pen.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: What... was... that thing?  10.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: We have to go. It's coming back for you.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Coming back!? It was hurt--

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER
dialogues.text: You temporarily scared it off. A Minotaur can only be killed by severing the horn from its body. Brunner EXITS, followed by a confused Percy.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: A Minotaur! ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grover is asleep, an open copy of MAXIM lying on his blan Percy and Brunner enter.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Pack only what you need. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Can you tell me what's going on?!

dialogues.speaker: BRUNNER
dialogues.text: No time. Grover. Out of bed. Grover groggily gets out of bed, LED into the hallway by Brunner. Percy grabs a backpack and begins to PACK. From the hallway, we hear Grover and Brunner's WHISPERING. Per stops packing, slowly walks to the door, EAVESDROPS. Outside, THUNDER RUMBLES. Brunner WHISPERS to Grover.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Today. In the bathroom. The water. It was a sign. (a beat) Percy's powers have begun to surface.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Why now?

dialogues.speaker: BRUNNER
dialogues.text: It happens when their lives are in danger.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Danger?

dialogues.speaker: BRUNNER
dialogues.text: He was attacked. By a Minotaur.  11.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: What? But why?

dialogues.speaker: BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Listen. What do you hear?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Thunder.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNNER
dialogues.text: But no lightning.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: (trying to understand) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Stolen. And they suspect Percy.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNNER
dialogues.text: I know. But because of who he is... Everyone thinks he did it.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Oh, man... Nowhere is safe for him.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNNER
dialogues.text: Only one place.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Right... You want me to take him there?

dialogues.speaker: BRUNNER
dialogues.text: (nods ) Pick up Sally along the way. Grover nods. An ANGUISHED ROAR echoes from outside. The C of the Minotaur. Grover and Brunner turn, HURRY back to Percy's bedroom. Percy RACES back inside, resumes packing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grover and Percy sit inside a crowded subway train. Grove is SILENT. Percy is ANXIOUS, wants information.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Would you please tell me what's going on? What's all this stuff about my powers starting to surface? What powers? And me stealing something!? Is that why nowhere is safe for me?  12.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: (softly, paranoid) Quiet. Keep your voice down. They could be listening.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Who? Who could be listening?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: (whispering) Not here. Not with all of these people around. No one can be trusted. Grover glares at an ELDERLY LADY who is staring at him. Percy shakes his head, thinks Grover is crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A working class neighborhood. Grover and Percy exit the subway, HURRYING along the sidewalk. Grover is TENSE, ANXIOUS, suspiciously eyeing anyone who passes by.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Why did Brunner send you home with me?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: To keep you safe.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: You're gonna' keep me safe?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: I'm your protector. Percy responds with an incredulous LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: What's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's just... well, you--

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: (angry, hurt) What? You think because I'm disabled?... I'm not capable of keeping you safe?... Huh?... Is that it?...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I didn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: (insulted, softly) You didn't have to.  13. Percy sighs, feels TERRIBLE. They arrive in front of a small, mean, WOODEN TWO-STORY HOME, sandwiched between RO of similar homes. They walk to the door and ENTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GABE UGLIANO, Percy's 39-year old, sloppy, overweight stepfather sits at a table in this cramped apartment, pla cards with four POKER BUDDIES. Several empty BEER BOTTLES are on the table. 70's SOUTHERN ROCK plays in the BG.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This disgusting slob is my step-father Gabe Ugliano. I call him "Smelly Gabe" because he never showers, puts Tabasco and garlic on everything he eats, and... Gabe lifts a butt-cheek off his chair and lets one RIIIII

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You get the picture. Sometimes when Gabe drinks too much... he fights with my Mom... screams at her, slaps her around... A real prince.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (calls OFFSCREEN) Sally? Hey? Can we get a couple beers? Percy's mom, SALLY,enters, carrying a six pack. Sally is her mid-30's, attractive, beaten-down by a hard life. There's a toughness, an inner strength, a radiant glow ab her. Gabe takes the beers, looks at his friends.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Ya' know, guys... If God wanted men to get their own beer, he wouldn't have invented wives... Sally forces a smile, places the beers on the table.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My mom, on the other hand, is an angel. I could never understand what she was doing with this jerk. Gabe pulls Sally in for a sloppy kiss, GRABS her ass.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Just kiddin', babe. C'mere...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Get your hands off my Mother. Everyone TURNS. Percy and Grover stand in the doorway. Sally is SURPRISED, but delighted by the appearance of Pe

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Percy! Sally rushes to Percy, embraces him. She notices Grover, kisses his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Grover?... You too?... (suspicious, to Percy) What are you doing home?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Probably got his ass kicked out of another school.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Disrespect my Mom again and you'll get your ass kicked out in the street.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Yeah!? Let's see what you got-- Gabe stands, in a drunken rage, GRABS Percy by the collar Ready for a FIGHT. Gabe's gonna' kill him. Grover BRINGS DOWN his crutch. HARD. ON TOP off Gabe's foot. Gabe CRIES OUT. Grover feigns an apology.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Oh, geez. Sorry. New crutches. Grover MOVES his crutch from Gabe's foot, LIFTS IT... thi time SLAMMING Gabe in the balls. Gabe CRUMBLES to his kne

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: I am so clumsy. Are you okay? The wind KNOCKED OUT of him, Gabe is helped back into his chair by his friends. Grover LEANS to Percy, whispers.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: I'm your protector. You cool with that? Percy hides a small smile, NODS. Sally hurriedly LEADS th boys out of the room, into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Why do you stay with that smelly pig?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Not another word. He's been good to us in ways you'll never know. (to Grover) Now... what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go. To the camp.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Right now? Why?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Percy's in danger. They're coming after him. They think he stole-- From OFFSCREEN, we hear a LOUD, INHUMAN ROAR. Grover pani

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: The Minotaur!

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Relax... It's only Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: We'll take Gabe's car. C'mon. They hurriedly exit through the BACK DOOR. Grover quickly SNATCHES a jumbo bag of Cheetos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered, rusted orange '78 CAMARO, complete with racin stripes, SPEEDS out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro is the only car on the road, moving deeper int the dense countryside. On one side of the road, miles and miles of TREES. On the other side, a hilly FIELD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally is at the wheel. Grover is in the back seat, nervou gobbling Cheetos and checking a ROAD MAP. Percy turns to Sally. He's UPSET. WORRIED.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Mom, I don't know what's going on. But I didn't steal anything. I swear...

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I believe you, honey. I know that you're scared and confused right now. Trust me, I didn't want any of this for you. I thought you could have an ordinary life. (warm, loving) But nothing about you could ever be ordinary.  16.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: So where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Think of it as a camp. A camp for special people. Like you. And your father.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: (bitter) Great. A camp full of losers.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Your father was not a loser. He was a great... man.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: A great man who abandoned his family.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: He did not abandon us, Percy. He had to leave. He couldn't live in our world.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Our world? Who was my Dad? £.T.?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Percy. You know all the myths about the Greek gods and goddesses? Well, they're not really myths. The gods are alive. They're here.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: What?...

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: You saw the Minotaur...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Right. Okay. But, I mean... if the Gods are real, wouldn't they be in Greece?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: They were. A long time ago. But the Gods tend to follow the heart of the West. They've been settled in America for the past two centuries.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: What does this have to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Remember what Brunner said in class?... Sometimes when the Gods are down here on Earth, they fall in love with mortals... have kids...  17.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Demigods...

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Half-god and half-mortal. There are hundreds living in the world right now. Some lead normal lives, others become pretty famous.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (turns to him, dead serious) You're a Demi-God. Percy is stunned. SPEECHLESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro passes a field of grazing CATTLE. As the car passes, one of the cows RAISES its enormous head, above t rest. It's a large BULL'S HEAD with TWISTED HORNS. It follows the Camaro with GLOWING YELLOW EYES. The MINOTAUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car continues down the deserted, DARK ROAD. Percy is still shocked by the news. Sally EXPLAINS.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I was young when we met, just out of school, working at a resort for the summer, right on the ocean. Your Father was...not like any guy I had ever met. He was just... dazzling.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: They're always dazzling.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: We were very much in love... And then... you came along... But he had to leave...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: So he did abandon us.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: He had no choice. The Gods, by their very nature, can't live among mortals. They are responsible for an entire universe...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Then maybe they shouldn't have kids.  18.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Your Father loved you, Percy. Leaving you was probably the most difficult thing he ever did.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: (pauses, softens) What was his name? Sally turns, ABOUT TO TELL Percy who his Father was. A lo INHUMAN ROAR fills the air. Grover LOOKS OUT the window. When SUDDENLY... CHUD! A COW lands in the road, in front of them. Sally screams, SWERVES to miss the animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro FLIPS onto its side, CAREENS off the road. It SKIDS into a ditch, coming to a STOP beside a VAST FOREST tall PINE TREES. SMOKE pours from beneath the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In PAIN, Percy grabs his head. He sees Sally, SLUMPED ove the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Mom?... Mom?!?... Sally stirs, more STUNNED than hurt.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I'm okay. How's Grover? He raises his head up from the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Is it just me, or is it raining cows? The car suddenly SHAKES, from an IMPACT TREMOR. This is followed by several IMPACT TREMORS. Something very large, very HEAVY, is running toward them. Percy looks out the m splattered back window. He SEES... COWS, being THROWN INTO THE AIR, flying LEFT AND RIGHT. A MONSTROUS THING plows through them, heading TOWARD THE CA

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Everyone out! Sally THROWS HERSELF against the driver's side door. It i JAMMED SHUT. Percy TRIES TO OPEN his door. Also jammed. The creature is GETTING CLOSER... CLOSER...  19. Grover REMOVES his sneakers, strips off his baggy pants.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: My job. Grover lifts his feet, revealing that they are... THICK, FURRY HOOVES. Percy stares at Grover's hooves, SHOCKED.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Okay. So you're half donkey.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Goat actually. Grover PULLS BACK his leg. With a POWERFUL KICK, he SHATT the rear window and CLIMBS out of the back window. Percy ASSISTS his mom out of the car. When Percy climbs out, he sees Grover standing in all his glory... He's a SATYR.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Follow me. With tremendous speed and agility, Grover RUN/GALLOPS tow the PINE FOREST. Percy and Sally FOLLOW. They glance over their shoulder and see... The MINOTAUR, stepping into the road, spotlighted by the car's HEADLIGHTS. The creature stops at the car, SNUFFLES nuzzling at the windows. A few feet away, at the edge of the pine forest, Sally, Percy, and Grover stop, looking back at the Minotaur. The Minotaur unleashes a CHILLING, ANGRY HOWL, turns toward S and the boys.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: He just picked up our scent. Run! They SPRINT OFF, into the pine forest. The angry Minotaur PICKS UP the Camaro, LIFTS IT and HURL the car in their general direction. The car FLIES toward Percy, Sally and Grover, SMASHING through the pine trees. Sally TACKLES Grover and Percy, PINNING THEM to the groun The car FLIES OVER their heads, MISSING THEM by inches. I lands with a CRASH, only a few feet in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Gabe's gonna' be pissed.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I always hated that car.  20. They quickly get back on their feet, hearing the Minotaur SMASHING and BREAKING the trees, as he CHARGES after them

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: C'mon. We're almost there. Grover POINTS just ahead of them. There is an OLD WOODEN GATE/ARCHWAY, leading into a small clearing. Faded GREEK LETTERS arc across the top of the gate. Percy, Sally and Grover RUN FOR THEIR LIVES, toward the g The Minotaur CHASES them, GETTING CLOSER... Percy, Sally and Grover reach the gate. Percy LOOKS UP at the letters. PERCY'S POV: The letters SHAPE-SHIFT, MORPH into English letters. Percy reads the words.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Camp. Half. Blood. Grover GRABS Percy, PULLS HIM THROUGH the open wooden gat Sally STOPS at the entrance. She DOESN'T go through. The Minotaur CRASHES through a row of pines. MOVING FAST. Less than FIFTY YARDS AWAY. Percy looks back to his Mom, sees that she's STOPPED.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Mom! What are you doing!?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I can't go any further. Percy REACHES OUT, GRABS his Mother's arms, TRIES TO PULL through the Camp Entrance. AN INVISIBLE, FORCE FIELD WALL prevents Sally from entering. Percy CAN'T PULL HER THROUG

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I can't go through. I'm not like you. The Minotaur STOMPS forward. Only a FEW FEET AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I love you, Percy. Now go. Please.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving without you!

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: You have to. You're meant to. Sally PULLS HER ARM FREE from Percy. She takes a step bac just as the Minotaur ARRIVES. Percy REACHES for his Mothe again, but the beast grabs Sally and pulls her AWAY.  21.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: No!!! Up ahead, Grover SKIDS to a stop, looks back and SEES... The Minotaur GRAB Sally by the neck and LIFT her off the ground. She STRUGGLES, kicking and pummeling the air. The Minotaur CLOSES HIS FISTS around Sally's neck. She ME into light, becoming a shimmering, GOLDEN FORM. There is BLINDING FLASH. And Sally DISAPPEARS. Simply... GONE.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Percy's face is covered with ANGER and GRIEF. He is fille with newfound strength, a rush of BURNING ENERGY. Percy CHARGES toward the beast. Grover runs toward him, YELLS -

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Percy! Don't-- Percy RUNS up to the Minotaur and LEAPS onto its back. Th creature TOSSES HIM OFF like a rag doll. The force SENDS Percy FLYING INTO A TREE. HARD. He FALLS onto the ground. Motionless. EYES CLOSED. The Minotaur LOWERS ITS HEAD and CHARGES Percy. At the la moment, Percy ROLLS OUT OF THE WAY. The Minotaur JUST MISSES him and PLOWS into a tree. HEAD FIRST. The Minotaur's horn GETS STUCK in the trunk. With LOUD ROAR, the Minotaur PULLS BACK its head. There is a HORRID SNAP of bone. The Minotaur's horn SNAPS OFF, RIPPE from its head, now STUCK in the tree. FURIOUS, the Minotaur turns to Percy and ROARS. A weakene Percy takes a step back, his legs SHAKING. The Minotaur RACES toward him, ready to FINISH THIS. As the Minotaur CHARGES, Percy RUNS to the tree. He PULLS the Minotaur's horn OUT OF THE TREE. Percy STABS the creature, PLUNGING the horn into the midd of the Minotaur's chest. The Minotaur HOWLS IN PAIN. BLAC BLOOD pours from the wound. The Minotaur FALLS to the ground. DEAD. Breathless and weak, Percy STANDS over the fallen Minotau Percy DROPS the horn, LOOKS UP, the trees SPIN. Percy's e ROLL BACK. Softly, he speaks...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Mom... He FAINTS.  22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy is lying on a HOSPITAL BED. ANNABETH, a 17 year old girl with stunning GREY EYES and curly blond hair, stares down at him. She's wearing body armor and is covered in sweat and dirt, but she's still radiant.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: This is him? Doesn't look tough enough to kill a Minotaur. I'm not impressed. Percy's eyes slowly flutter OPEN. He stares up into Annabeth's hypnotic, grey eyes, sees all of her BEAUTY. Light reflects off her armor making her look otherworldly

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Hello--

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: You drool when you sleep. Wipe your mouth. Percy wipes his mouth, Grover steps out from behind Annab

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Welcome back, Buddy. Percy notices the cacophony of MOANS and GROANS. He sees that his bed is one of several dozen, inside of a large, stone walled INFIRMARY. Kids, ages 11-18, are in the beds They are BATTERED and BRUISED, some with broken bones.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: The infirmary. You've been unconscious for three days. Percy tries to sit up, but he's IN PAIN. Annabeth shoves GOBLET filled with a GOLD, GLOWING LIQUID in his face.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Drink this. It'll make you feel better. Percy sniffs it, not sure.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Don't be a weasel. Percy smiles, takes a SIP. Grover and Annabeth watch him expectantly. He looks instantly REJUVENATED.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Good stuff. What is it?  23.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Ambrosia and nectar. Food of the Gods.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Tastes like my Mom's caramel brownies.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: It always tastes like your favorite food.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: (checks clock) Time for more training. (to Percy, sarcastic) See you on the battlefield... hero. She CLANKS away in her armor, carrying a shield and sword As Percy watches her, he hears more CLANGING as several k covered in dirt, mud and blood, wearing classic GREEK BAT ARMOR over jeans and T-shirts, are carried in on STRETCHE

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: What happened to them?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: She did. Percy grins, thinks it's a joke. Grover's not laughing.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Do you remember anything?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Just some crazy dream. My Mom was there. There was a Minotaur... And you were some kinda' weird hybrid goat thing-- He looks at Grover, then trails his eyes from Grover's fa down to his lower half which is completely VISIBLE now, f arched legs, goat butt, hooves and all.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Actually, I prefer "Satyr". (a beat) Oh. And this is yours. He hands Percy the Minotaur HORN. Percy stares at it. His expression darkens. REALIZATION sets in.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: It was real. All of it was real.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: (ashamed, heartbroken) I'm sorry, Percy. It's my fault. I blew it. It was my job to protect you. Both of you.  24. Percy stares at the horn. His expression is sad, filled w despair. He speaks softly, in grief. TEARS fill his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: My Mom. She's really gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy is dressed, depressed, walking with Grover down the aisle, past the beds, past the MOANING, BATTERED KIDS. Pe looks at all of the wounded kids.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Where are we? CAMERA FOLLOWS THEM as they step out of the Infirmary and stand at the top of a hill, looking out over...

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Camp Half Blood. The camp is spread across several acres of a beautiful, l landscape surrounded by a pine forest. The buildings' architecture is straight out of ancient Greece. Construct of stone and marble, with weathered, well-worn, facades. small COLISEUM is visible in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Created by the Olympians, for their offspring. Demigods. Kids like you. Percy stands in awe. Speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy and Grover walk through the camp. Hundreds of kids, aged 11 to 21, dressed in modern clothing, are everywhere They walk past several kids sitting inside a small outdoo amphitheater, as an OLD, BLIND POET recites Homer's Odyss

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: This is where you guys learn to harness your powers, to become leaders, warriors... artists... and heroes...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You got the wrong guy. I'm no hero... I'm a screw-up... with dyslexia, ADHD...

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Those are your greatest gifts.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: You call those gifts?  25. They pass other kids FIRING ARROWS in an ARCHERY RANGE; throwing JAVELINS; forging WEAPONS in a Blacksmith furnac making VASES at a potter's wheel.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: When you try to read, the letters seem to float off the page, right? That's because your brain's hard-wired for ancient Greek. Not English. I bet you had no trouble reading the book Mr. Brunner gave you in detention...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: That was Greek?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: (nods ) And your ADHD? You're impulsive, you can't sit still. Those are your natural battle reflexes. They kept you alive when you fought the Minotaur. No mortal screw-up could defeat the Minotaur, Percy. Your blood is special. It's... (somber ) The blood of a God.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: And these kids?... They're all sons and daughters of gods?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: And goddesses. They pause at a practice BATTLEFIELD. Annabeth SWORDFIGHT beating several stronger, male opponents. Percy WATCHES, very ATTRACTED to her.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Smokin', huh?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Her name?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Annabeth. Daughter of Athena. Goddess of Wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I thought Athena was a virgin goddess...  26.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: She was. But you try holding out for 10,000 years. I barely make it through health class. Percy and Grover walk to the edge of the coliseum. A HORS RACE is in progress. EIGHT HORSES circle the track in a CLOUD OF DUST. They are SILHOUETTED against the bright ra of the afternoon sun. As the horses reach the finish, the dust clears. Percy's mouth drops when he sees that they are CENTAURS. HALF-MAN HALF-HORSE. One of the Centaurs walks away, TROTS toward Percy. As the Centaur gets closer, Percy RECOGNIZES him.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Mr. Brunner!?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNNER/CHIRON
dialogues.text: Here, I'm known as Chiron. Nice to see you up and around.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: You're... you're...

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: A real horse's ass, I know. I'm sorry I had to keep my true form hidden from you, but it was for your own good. I hope you'll forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: What happened to your wheelchair?...

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Only when I'm in mortal form. I could never walk on only two legs. He leads Percy and Grover away. They WALK through the cam with Chiron.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Is this your camp?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: No. I'm just an overseer and a trainer. Chiron enters an ALCOVE, nestled in the woods by the lake Eleven distinct frat-like houses, are arranged around a common area, dotted with old STATUES and ancient FOUNTAIN

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: This is where you'll be staying.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Greek Row.  27. The first "house" they pass has several SMOKESTACKS belch BLACK SMOKE. Outside, a few kids covered in sweat and gri work billows and anvils.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: The heirs of Hephaestus, smith and weapon- maker of the Gods. Chiron and Percy continue on, past a BUILDING that resemb a FORTRESS. BARBED-WIRE fencing surrounds the lawn. ANGRY MUSIC BLASTS from within. A dozen BIG, UGLY, MEAN KIDS ar YELLING at each other, some are physically fighting.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: The offspring of Ares, God of War. The next home is filled with dozens of HYPER, ENERGETIC K running through the lawn, playing pranks, laughing. They have sharp noses, upturned eyebrows and mischievous smile

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Those pranksters are the offspring of Hermes, messenger of the gods. One of Hermes' SONS motions to a nearby BROTHER, clearly to something. He's watching: the sorority house next door It is decorated with romantic statues and gardens, the mo lush home on Greek row. The GIRLS who live here are drop dead gorgeous, most of them outside SUNBATHING. Grover stops dead in his tracks, frozen like he's fightin urge... and desperately losing.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Daughters of Aphrodite, goddess of love and other four letter words. SPRINKLERS go off, drenching the girls. They SCREAM, run inside. Hermes' sons roll on the ground laughing.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: I'll catch up with you guys later. Grover makes a MAD DASH toward the drenched daughters of Aphrodite, CHASING them around the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Satyrs. You can never completely train them to stop chasing the nymphs. Chiron and Percy round the "U" and stop at one of the lar homes in Greek Row. The home looks as if it were made of CORAL. A LARGE FOUNTAIN is in front. Chiron turns to Perc

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Welcome home.  28. Percy is taken aback, yet INTRIGUED.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Your Father built this. For you.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: My Father? Chiron lifts his front legs, and KICKS OPEN the doors.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Poseidon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy and Chiron enter Poseidon's home. Most of the inter is taken up by a large INDOOR POOL. The stairways are lin with cascading waterfalls. There are many statues of HORS And a wall filled with various ancient, rusted METAL TRIDENTS. Percy stares in AWE.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Your father is God of the Seas, as well as horses and earthquakes. It was his wish that you lead a normal life. He asked me to watch over you and, when you got older, I chose Grover to be your protector. Percy looks at the collection of rusted TRIDENTS, grabs o

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Why didn't my mom ever tell me?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: She couldn't. It was for your own safety. There hasn't been a Demi-God born of the Big Three in over a hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: The big three... Zeus, Hades and Poseidon?...

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: (nods ) That makes you special, powerful, a threat. That's why your Mom married your step-father. His rather pungent odor masked the smell of your blood, in case you were ever in danger.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Like the Minotaur...  29.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: So Gabe's ass saved mine?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: I wouldn't put it that way, but yes.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: But why am I in danger? Why are things chasing me, trying to kill me?...

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Actually. For the time being. They prefer that you stay alive.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: They think you've stolen something valuable.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: But, I didn't steal anything...

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: I believe you. Not many others do. Zeus has convinced almost everyone, that you're... (a beat) The Lightning Thief. Percy is confused. Chiron points to the palace ceiling. Here, is a stunning THREE DIMENSIONAL PAINTING, depicting history of the Gods. It makes the Sistine Chapel look pedestrian. Chiron points to a powerful image of Zeus, riding in the clouds, the powerful MASTER BOLT in hand.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Zeus' Master bolt. The bolt where all lightning originates. The most powerful weapon ever created, harnessing more power than several hydrogen bombs. It was stolen four days ago.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Why do they think it was me? Chiron points to an image of Zeus in combat against Posei

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: When the bolt disappeared, Zeus naturally blamed your father. They've been ina power struggle for centuries. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But ancient law forbids Gods to cross into each other's realm. Only a Demi-God is capable of that. Someone like you. Zeus' closest relative.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: But I've never even met my Father... And I sure as hell wouldn't do his dirty work...

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Unless the bolt is returned by midnight of the summer solstice, two weeks from now, there will be a war of the gods.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: (mocking) Zeus vs. Poseidon. Two gods enter the ring, only one will leave.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: War between the Gods is a serious matter, Percy. Olympians will be forced to choose sides. Nature will turn against itself. Modern civilization will be destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: (pause, concerned) So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: For the next few days, we stay here. Until Zeus calms down. Then we go to Olympus, where you'll convince Zeus of your innocence. Percy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grover walks up the stairs, of the palace, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grover enters, looks around. No sign of Percy.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Percy? No answer. Grover walks around, looks into the pool. FLOATING at the bottom, is Percy. Eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Hey! Wake up!  31.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (opens his eyes, sleepy) What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: 6:00 AM. Chiron sent me. He wants you to start training. Percy climbs out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Training for what?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: This isn't celebrity rehab. There are things trying to kill you, remember? Big. Scary. Things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is GRAY, OMINOUS. There are several WEATHERED TEN scattered around the grounds, the type of tents used on t ancient battlefields of Rome and Greece. Dozens of kids, in armor, SHARPEN their swords, practice battle moves. Percy walks onto the battlefield, wearing ARMOR, holding heavy shield and sword. He looks extremely uncomfortable awkward in it. Grover is beside him.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: How do you move in all this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: You get used to it. Or you get killed. Percy gives a nervous laugh. Grover is dead serious. When the other kids see Percy, they all stop and stare, whispe each other... "Is that him?" The Lightning Thief?... Son Poseidon?... Slayed the Minotaur..." Percy notices Annabeth, wearing a RED PLUME surrounded by team, all wearing Red Plumes. Annabeth uses her sword poi to draw a game plan in the dirt. CHIRON trots up.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Heroes! Warriors! Fall in! The young warriors line up in FORMATION by teams. RED PLU on one side; BLUE PLUMES on the other. Annabeth is CAPTAI of the Red soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Today, we have some new blood in our midst. Percy? Step forward.  32. Percy pauses, then STEPS FORWARD. The kids crane their ne to get a good look at Percy, FASCINATED by him. Percy smi an Annabeth, but she just stares at him stoically.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: This is Percy Jackson. He's going to need a team. LUKE, a small, energetic, impish kid with a thin sloping and a mischievous smile, steps forward. Luke is CAPTAIN o the Blue soldiers. He holds an ancient BRONZE SHIELD with SEVERAL WARRIORS carved into the surface.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: We'll take him. Luke hands Percy a blue plumed helmet.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I'm Luke. Son of Hermes. Percy takes his helmet and... BUZZZ! Percy gets a a HUGE ELECTRICAL SHOCK from the helmet! SPARKS FLY! Percy jumps back, drops the helmet. Luke turns to his teammates.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I dunno'... Maybe it isn't so safe to have a lightning thief on our team... Everyone is staring at Percy. Suddenly, they all break up LAUGHING. Luke picks up Percy's helmet, removes an electrical JOY BUZZER from inside. Luke grins at Percy.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Just bustin' your balls. Couldn't resist. My old man's God of the Pranksters... It's in the blood. Percy forces a smile, nods, takes the blue helmet from Lu

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: You all know the rules. First team to capture the enemy flag wins. Assume your last positions and remember... We fight to build each other up, not to tear each other down. Use your skills on the battlefield, but save your true anger for the dark forces. The Red soldiers start MARCHING OFF into the forest. Perc turns to Chiron, NERVOUS.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I thought this was a game... I don't know how to use this stuff.  33.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: You defeated the Minotaur.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: But I had that cool flic-a-bic-sword...

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: That would give you an unfair advantage over the red team. Just relax. Demigods all have some degree of inherited skill. Hercules was only a level three when I began teaching him.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: You taught Hercules?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Chiron trained all the great Demigods. Hercules, Alexander the Great, Bruce Lee, Michael Jordan... turned them all into heroes.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: They turned themselves into heroes. I only trained them. (confident) Just do what comes naturally, Percy. You'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Blue team... Move out! They march off into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reds and Blues CLASH! Kids THRASH relentlessly at each other, dealing powerful blows. Swords CLANG against shiel and armor. In the midst of it all, Annabeth savagely HACK her way through dozens of the blue soldiers. Several of t blue team RUN OFF. Annabeth removes a BOW, pulls ARROWS f a quiver and FIRES a barrage at the fleeing blue soldiers The arrows PIN kids to trees, safely, by piercing through their clothes, etc. One KID is TRAPPED by an ARROW on eac side of his head and one between his legs. Annabeth gets right in his face, SNARLS.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Where is Percy Jackson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy, Luke, and the blue soldiers are CAUTIOUSLY MOVING through the forest. Percy LOOKS AROUND. Nervous. Suddenly several Red soldiers appear, COMING RIGHT AT THEM.  34.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Incoming! Blues and Reds CLASH. METAL ON METAL. Percy DUCKS, avoids blows and ends up face-to-face with an angry SON OF ARES. The Son of Ares comes at Percy, SWINGING. Percy DEFLECTS first several blows, but gets KNOCKED DOWN by the proceed FLURRY OF HITS. LUKE appears and with two FAST SWINGS, ta out the Son of Ares. Luke EXTENDS his hand to Percy.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Shake it off. As Percy gets to his feet, more red soldiers ATTACK. Luke and the other Blues FIGHT BACK. A red soldier starts PUMMELING Percy. Percy FIGHTS BACK. The two kids are in a HEATED BATTLE. Percy manages to deliver a HARD KICK to th red soldier's midsection. The red soldier FALLS to the ground. Momentarily WINDED. Percy SPRINTS into the pine forest. Red soldiers FOLLOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy STOPS, catches his breath, next to a SMALL CREEK. Percy looks around. NO SIGN of his pursuers. Percy takes off his helmet, BREATHLESS. He kneels beside the creek, SPLASHES water on his face. H sees something REFLECTED in the water... A RED FLAG. It's FEW FEET AWAY on the other side of the creek. Percy steps INTO THE WATER. He WADES across the creek. TOWARD the flag. Percy STEPS OUT of the water, walks TOWARD the red flag. REACHES forward... about to PICK IT UP... A DOZEN RED SOLDIERS DROP from the trees. They SURROUND Percy. He PUTS ON his helmet, takes a DEFENSIVE STANCE.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Did you think it would be that easy? ANNABETH appears..

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: My mother is the Goddess of Wisdom and Battle Strategy. You know what that means? I never lose. The Red Soldiers ATTACK Percy. Percy is able to DEFLECT nearly half the blows. But they soon OVERCOME him. He is HIT. SEVERAL TIMES.  35. Percy FALLS to his knees. He is BLOODIED. BEATEN. EXHAUSTED. Annabeth steps forward, looks down at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: You actually claim to be the Son of Poseidon and the slayer of the Minotaur!? The other Red soldiers BACK AWAY, give Annabeth her space

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Stand up. Fight. Percy slowly GETS TO HIS FEET. Annabeth EXTENDS her sword ARMED and READY. Percy EXTENDS his sword.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Let's see what you're really made of. Their EYES MEET, displaying a shared sense of intense EXCITEMENT and ATTRACTION. They begin a HEATED SWORDFIGHT Percy LUNGES, Annabeth SLASHES his arm. Percy tries to defend against Annabeth's ASSAULT. He's NO MATCH for her. Annabeth is more ADVANCED, more EXPERIENCED... Several RED and BLUE SOLDIERS gather on opposite sides of creek, WATCHING the fight. Luke, Grover and Chiron ARRIVE

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Should we stop it?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Not yet. Annabeth SLASHES Percy at every opportunity... Percy's ar and legs have deep CUTS on them. There's a WOUND above hi right eye. He is WEAK, can barely hold his sword up. Annabeth is starting to SYMPATHIZE with him...

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Surrender... Percy shakes his head. NO WAY. He attacks SLOWLY, EXHAUSTED. His swings are LABORED. Annabeth easily DEFLEC the blows. Annabeth RAISES her sword, flips it in the air, grabs it the blade and SWINGS IT at Percy's head. CRACK! Percy's helmet FLIES OFF his head. He FALLS down, into the shallo waters at the CREEK'S EDGE. Almost UNCONSCIOUS. The red soldiers RAISE their swords in the air and chant:

dialogues.speaker: ATHENA
dialogues.text: They CONGRATULATE Annabeth, but she doesn't look happy. S watches Percy, feeling REMORSEFUL.  36. Percy's bloody, battered body LIES A FEW FEET FROM THE RIVER'S EDGE. Blood DRIPS from his mouth. A DISTANT MALE VOICE echoes in his head.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Go to the water, Percy... The water... Percy uses his last bit of strength, CRAWLING toward the water. He COLLAPSES... His FINGERTIPS TOUCH THE WATER. Suddenly... WATER from the creek SLITHERS up Percy's hand arm, moving around Percy's body. The water CRAWLS up Perc skin and COVERS HIM in a thin wet veneer. Percy's wounds INSTANTLY HEAL. Percy's EYES OPEN. His muscles TIGHTEN. His hand moves an GRABS the handle of his sword. He slowly RISES to his fee Behind him, the water in the creek SHOOTS UP into the air All of the kids stare in AWE. Annabeth turns to see what happening. She is struck SPEECHLESS by the sight of Percy dripping wet, standing in front of a GIANT WATER TRIDENT. SIX RED SOLDIERS rush forward to ATTACK. Fighting like an expert soldier, Percy quickly and effortlessly TAKES THEM DOWN, one by one. Then, Annabeth CHARGES Percy. Their blades CLASH. It's a hard fought, INTENSE DUEL. Percy skillfully KNOCKS the sword out of Annabeth's hand sends her FALLING to the ground. He stands over Annabeth, staring confidently down into her eyes. The tip of his sw is POINTED at her HEART.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: You drool when you're impressed. Wipe your mouth. Annabeth wipes her mouth and then... exchanges a slow smi with Percy. He RAISES his sword high in the air.

dialogues.speaker: POSEIDON
dialogues.text: Kids start chanting "POSEIDON! POSEIDON!" but it soon tur to "PERCY! PERCY! PERCY!" Luke can't believe what he just witnessed. Grover runs up and practically tackles Percy. Standing apart from the crowd, CHIRON watches. A small smile appears on his lips. Percy looks at Chiron, gives a small, confident nod.  37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge BONFIRE rages in the common's area of Greek Row. K from all the houses are celebrating, like warriors after battle. SATYRS and CENTAURS mingle with the kids. GLOWING AMBROSIA flows from large jars into mugs and goblets. A W BOAR cooks on a spit. Percy and Grover work their way toward the Ambrosia. Kids congratulate Percy, patting him on the back. He seems ill ease with the attention. Two APHRODITE GIRLS smile at Per oozing sex appeal.

dialogues.speaker: APHRODITE GIRL ONE
dialogues.text: I love a man who can handle a sword. Nearby, Annabeth is talking to a few kids. She glances ov SEES the girls fawning over Percy. A flicker of jealousy registers on Annabeth's face. The Aphrodite Girls turn to exit, each giving Percy a kiss to the cheek. Grover nearl faints. Annabeth walks up to Percy.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Feeling like a hero?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: More like a mutant. I'm not gonna' grow a fish tail or gills or anything like that?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Not likely. Although a huge ego isn't out of the question. Annabeth fills a goblet with golden Ambrosia. Percy is attracted to her, yet cautious, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: You know... you almost killed me out there. I could've died... If I was normal.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: But you aren't. Besides... I always knew.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: How? She hands him the goblet of Ambrosia.  38.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: You drank the Ambrosia. There's a reason it's called "food of the gods." If a pure mortal drank Ambrosia, it would kill them. Your blood would have boiled and your bones turned to dust.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: But you didn't know that when you gave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Women's intuition.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Intuition? You bet my life on intuition? She shrugs, smiles, takes a long drink of Ambrosia. Percy NARROWS his eyes, looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I get the sense that you don't like me very much...

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: It's possible. I mean... Our parents hate each other.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: They do?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: (nods ) And I definitely have strong feelings for you. I just haven't decided if they're positive or negative.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Let me know when you figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: You'll be the first. She smiles, raises her glass, DRINKS. Percy does the same Their eyes are LOCKED. A SPARK of romance. She suddenly FREEZES, spots something OFFSCREEN. In the distance, Annabeth sees THREE PAIRS of glowing RED DOTS.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: No... That can't be possible...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: What?  39. He turns. The red eyes are getting CLOSER... and CLOSER.. Annabeth screams, warning the others...

dialogues.speaker: HELLHOUNDS
dialogues.text: Everyone stops what they're doing. The kids see the trio red eyes. They PANIC, RUNNING FOR THEIR LIVES.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: How did they get in?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: I don't know... The camp's under a veil of protection against underworld forces... Someone must have lifted it... THREE HELLHOUNDS charge into the camp. They are DEMONIC BEASTS, hounds the size of buffalo. Lava-red eyes, fangs like daggers. Chiron runs up, SHOVES Percy out of the way just as one of the HOUNDS charges right at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Grover! Get Percy out of here! Chiron removes his PEN, flicks it. The pen TRANSFORMS INT THE SWORD. Centaurs and kids SPRING INTO ACTION. They gra THEIR SWORDS, BOWS AND ARROWS, and prepare to FIGHT. Perc GRABS a sword.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Percy, no!

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: They need help... The Hellhounds are RUTHLESS. They DRAG one kid away, anot gets MAULED. Annabeth fires a DOZEN ARROWS into one of th beasts but it DOESN'T PHASE the creature. The three Hellhounds CIRCLE BACK, seeking out Percy. They see him and CHARGE AT PERCY. Chiron LEAPS into the Hellhound's path and STABS ONE with his sword. It FALLS t the ground. DEAD. THREE OTHER CENTAURS surround another Hellhound. It CHARG right through them. Chiron HURLS the sword. It IMPALES th beast, killing it INSTANTLY.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Chiron! Watch out-- The last Hellhound HITS CHIRON. He FALLS, BLEEDING. Percy immediately GRABS Chiron's sword. The Hellhound see him, CHARGES. Percy RUNS STRAIGHT for the Hellhound!  40. They are on a COLLISION COURSE. At the last second before impact, Percy DROPS and SLIDES UNDER under the beast, rai his sword. It SLASHES along the beast's underside. The hellhound is mortally WOUNDED. Percy stands, looks down at the DYING beast. Grover and Annabeth JOIN Percy. The beast lifts its head, looks at Percy. The beast SPEAKS. A slow, weak, DEMONIC VOICE

dialogues.speaker: HELLHOUND
dialogues.text: Where... is the bolt?...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I don't have it. I'm not the thief.

dialogues.speaker: HELLHOUND
dialogues.text: Liar... If you want your Mother back... bring Hades the bolt...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: My Mother's dead.

dialogues.speaker: HELLHOUND
dialogues.text: No... She is still alive... abducted by Hades... Bring him the lightning bolt... in exchange for your Mother... The beast closes its eyes, its breathing slows to a STOP. DEAD. Percy exchanges a look with Annabeth and Grover. He turns, sees Chiron lying on the ground, his leg badly wounded. Percy RUNS to Chiron, Grover and Annabeth FOLLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with books, weapons, and alchemical devices. Chiro is sitting as Annabeth BANDAGES his leg wound. Grover and Percy are watching, but Percy's mind is miles away. He's flicking the pen-sword on and off. Chiron looks at Percy.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: That sword has a name. Percy reads the GREEK name ENGRAVED along the sword's han

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Anaklusmos.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: In English, it means "Riptide." I want you to keep it.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Really?  4l.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: You'll be needing it more than me. It's made of celestial bronze and lethal to any creature from the underworld.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Hades never sent his creatures into our camp before.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: With Olympus in turmoil he will only get bolder. And as long as he thinks Percy has the bolt, he'll stop at nothing. Percy stands, walks to Chiron, looks at him. Very solemn.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Chiron. The hellhound... It spoke to me... told me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallows back emotion) My Mom is alive.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: She was abducted by Hades. Is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: (nods ) Hades has been known to abduct the living... Like Persephone. His wife.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: The hellhound said that I can get her back, in return for the bolt...

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: But you don't have the bolt.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I know... But you said I could convince Zeus that I'm not the thief... Can't I do the same with Hades? When he realizes I don't have the bolt, he'll give me my Mother back.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: It isn't that simple.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Why not?  42.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Zeus and Hades are very different. Zeus can be stubborn, but he is honorable. Fair. Hades is a master of darkness and deceit. The personification of evil. When he finds out that you aren't the lightning thief, he'll kill both you and your Mother. There is SILENCE. Percy is DEVASTATED. HELPLESS.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: So... What can I do?... Chiron rises up, his wound dressed. He places his arm fir on Percy's shoulder, LOOKS him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRON
dialogues.text: Stay with our original plan. Tomorrow we go to Olympus. Once you've convinced Zeus of your innocence, we will do everything in our power to bring your Mother back. I swear. Percy, his face filled with FRUSTRATION and DISAPPOINTMEN looks at Chiron, and slowly nods. Grover and Annabeth exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door OPENS. Percy peeks outside. The coast is clear. He steps out with his backpack flung over his shoulder. A he starts to walk away, a VOICE INTERRUPTS...

dialogues.speaker: GROVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Going somewhere? Grover is sitting ON THE ROOF, chewing on a bushy plant. DROPS DOWN in front of Percy.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Out for a walk. Percy steps around him, continues on his way. Then Annabe WALKS OUT from behind the fountain, right in his path.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: One small victory and you think you're ready to take on the world?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: (passionate) Look... I just found out that my Mother is still alive. She's the most important thing in my life. And I'm going to get her back.  43.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: You're going to walk all the way to Hades and fight the Lord of the Underworld?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: If I have to.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Do you even know how to get there?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: If I had to guess I'd say: down.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: I can't let you do this.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I wasn't asking for permission.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: I mean, I can't let you go by yourself. I'm your protector. I'm going with you.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: I don't need any help. This is something I have to do alone.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: We weren't asking for permission. Percy looks at Annabeth. You too?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Earlier today you wanted to kill me, now you want to risk your life to help me?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: My mom always looks out for heroes. It's in my blood. And if we're going to succeed, it's going to take some brains, not just pretty blue eyes, a fancy pen, and a set of disgusting hooves. (to Grover) No offense.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Offense taken.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: So like it or not, Percy, you've got company. Percy looks at them, resigns himself.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: How do we get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is filled with fun house novelties: trick mirrors, clo a fortune teller machine, etc. Percy, Grover, and Annabet sit across from Luke.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What makes you think I would know something like that?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Your dad's the Messenger of the Gods. He's one of the few who can get in and out of the underworld. Surely he's told you something.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: My dad's a prick and I've never even met him.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Then we have a lot in common. Luke gives Percy a devilish smile.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: But I have broken into my Father's house on several occasions. Luke CLIMBS A LADDER to grab a SHOEBOX from a top shelf. TOSSES the shoebox to Percy, who opens it... Inside, is a pair of WINGED SNEAKERS. They're VERY COOL.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Flying shoes?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: My gift to you. Look underneath. Percy lifts the shoes out of the box. Beneath them, is a folded, yellowed piece of PARCHMENT. Percy OPENS it, revealing a tattered MAP OF THE UNITED STATES.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: People have gone to the underworld, without having to be dead. Hercules did. And Orpheus. Getting in is the easy part. It's getting out that's the trick. Luke points to the MAP. The town of RUMSON, NEW JERSEY begins to GLOW. An ADDRESS magically appears next to it.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: This will lead you to the locations of the three green pearls.  45.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Green pearls?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: This is a copy of a map that belongs to Hades' wife, Persephone. She keeps the green pearls hidden for her many lovers, to use when Hades is away. They provide a quick escape from the underworld. You can use them to get out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: How do they work?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Put a drop of your blood on the pearl, then shatter it. Close your eyes, and imagine the place you want to go. The pearls will take you there. They nod. Luke gives Percy one last item... His ANCIENT, ENGRAVED BRONZE SHIELD, with a SHINY GOLDEN HANDLE.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Take this.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Your shield?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: For protection.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: (touched) Thanks, Luke. Percy stands, to exit. Luke CALLS out to him.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Percy. Percy LOOKS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: If you run into my Father along the way...

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Kick his ass for me.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Deal.  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy, Grover, and Annabeth sit next to each other on the half-full bus. Percy is studying the MAP.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And that's how yours truly, Percy Jackson, son of Poseidon, ended up on the highway to Hell.

dialogues.speaker: AC/DC'S "HIGHWAY TO HELL" FILLS THE SOUNDTRACK. CAMERA
dialogues.text: DOLLIES into the map, zeroing in to the first location: NEW JERSEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deserted, two lane highway in the badlands of New Jerse The Greyhound bus pulls to the SIDE OF THE ROAD. Percy, Grover, and Annabeth step off the bus, all wearing back- packs. The bus PULLS AWAY. Across the street, is... AUNTIE EM'S GARDEN EMPORIUM. It's a rundown, corrugated steel "SHACK" with dead plants, cement fountains, and a d weathered statues -- CHERUBS, LIONS, ANGELS. The place fe deserted, save for TWO CARS parked in front: A rusted PIC UP TRUCK and a 1993 CADILLAC ELDORADO with ILLINOIS plate

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: You're sure this is the place?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: That's what the map says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids ENTER. It's dark, dusty, and DESERTED.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Hello? Anyone here? Grover picks up a cobwebbed phone, LISTENS for a dial ton

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Auntie 'Em must've gone back to Kansas. Percy opens the CASH REGISTER's drawer. It's full of Amer CASH and several ancient Greek GOLD COINS (DRACHMAS) . Percy pushes open the creaky SCREEN DOOR, leading to the lot. He steps OUTSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: Check this out.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabeth and Grover JOIN Percy. A winding, serpentine gra path leads through acres of STATUARY. Hundreds of LIFE-LI STATUES create a maze-like atmosphere. There are ANIMALS, TOURISTS, SOLDIERS from all eras, GARGOYLES, etc.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Must be thousands of 'em. How are we supposed to find a pearl in this cement stack?

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: You're the grand strategist. Grover walks to an old "ENJOY COCA-COLA" ice cooler.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Anyone thirsty? He opens it, startled to find dozens of LIVE MICE scurryi around inside. He quickly CLOSES the door.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Let's split up. Check every statue. The pearl could be inside one of them. They walk into the statue maze and SPLIT OFF in three directions. As they do, a GARGOYLE'S HEAD appears to TURN ever so slightly, in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grover HOBBLES among the statues, TAPPING them with an ANCIENT DAGGER. The statues are all SOLID and very LIFE- LIKE, in strange, everyday poses. Grover taps a ROMAN SOLDIER. SOLID. Grover moves on, the Roman Solider BEGINS TO MOVE and LIFTS HIS SWORD. Grover, hearing a NOISE, LOOKS BACK. NOTHING. The Roman Soldier is STIFF. But now his sword is HELD HIGH. Grover DOESN'T NOTICE and MOVES ON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy TAPS the statues. All SOLID. He comes upon a relatively new statue: a MIDDLE AGED MAN wearing a Chicag Cubs hat, holding a map as if he were asking for directio There's a look of HORROR on the man's face. At the end of the row, Percy sees a LARGE STATUE of a SLEEPING, COILED COBRA. Percy walks TOWARD it.  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabeth taps each statue and MARKS THEM with an "X" afte she's examined them. From the corner of Annabeth's eye, s sees a QUICK BLUR. Someone is RUNNING BETWEEN THE STATUES

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Hello? Is someone there? She turns and... SHOCK! Annabeth runs into a crazed, SCAR HYSTERICAL WOMAN, in her late fifties.

dialogues.speaker: HYSTERICAL WOMAN
dialogues.text: Have to leave... have to get out... She's coming...

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Who's coming? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: HYSTERICAL WOMAN
dialogues.text: We stopped... For directions... Bill... My husband... Stone... The Woman GRABS Annabeth, PULLS her through the maze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grover walks, FIVE MORE STATUES come to life. They FOL Grover like cement zombies, lead by the Roman Soldier. Ev time Grover TURNS BACK, the statues assume their FROZEN POSITION. Grover stops in front of a statue of an OLD SAT

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Hey. You look like my Uncle Ferdinand. But that's impossible. Uncle Ferdinand was killed by Medusa-- (sudden panic, swallows) Auntie 'Em. WHACK! A CONCRETE SWORD BLADE BARELY MISSES Grover and SHATTERS Uncle Ferdinand. Grover SPINS and finds himself SURROUNDED BY LIVING STATUES. They are CLOSING IN ON HIM.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: Percy! Annabeth! We're in Medusa's lair!

dialogues.speaker: ON PERCY
dialogues.text: Standing in front of the coiled Cobra as he hears Grover' warning. Suddenly the Serpent's EYES OPEN, revealing that one of them is a GREEN PEARL. The Cobra STRIKES at Percy. He ROLLS AWAY just in the nic of time. Percy WHIPS out his pen, CLICKS IT. The pen transforms into RIPTIDE...

dialogues.speaker: ON ANNABETH
dialogues.text: The Hysterical Woman LEADS Annabeth through the statue ma

dialogues.speaker: HYSTERICAL WOMAN
dialogues.text: Have to... get out... before... she finds us... Annabeth tries to break free, but the woman's grip is STR

dialogues.speaker: ON GROVER
dialogues.text: The statues CLOSE IN. Grover RAISES his crutches like they're Chinese fighting sticks. He KICKS OFF his shoes, exposing his HOOVES.

dialogues.speaker: GROVER
dialogues.text: You ugly stiffs want a fight? Grover goes all Shaolin-Satyr on their stone asses. He WHACKS them with his crutches, KICKS them with his powerf hooves. ONE KICK and the statues CRUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: ON PERCY
dialogues.text: The Cobra's tail WHIPS at him. Percy SLAMS into a group o statues, KNOCKS THEM OVER like bowling pins. Percy RISES The Cobra STRIKES AGAIN. Percy DIVES out of the way... ++.jJust as GROVER leaps into the action. The Cobra TURNS toward Grover. And in that instant, Percy HURLS his sword Riptide FLIES THROUGH THE AIR and IMPALES the Cobra, righ BELOW THE EYE. The Cobra FALLS, CRUMBLING into a hundred pieces.
